clusters.title: Top Zelenskyy aide resigns in midst of Ukraine corruption scandal
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelenskyy Aide Resigns Amid Corruption Allegations
bullet_summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators
Reported by Reuters Top News, CBS News, BBC World and others

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide resigns in midst of Ukraine corruption scandal
items.standfirst: A political earthquake in Ukraine has taken place as President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s chief of staff Andrii Yermak, the country’s second-most-powerful person, was forced to resign amid a corruption scandal. This comes as Ukraine is enmeshed in negotiations with the Trump administration on a…
items.content: A political earthquake in Ukraine has taken place as President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s chief of staff Andrii Yermak, the country’s second-most-powerful person, was forced to resign amid a corruption scandal. This comes as Ukraine is enmeshed in negotiations with the Trump administration on a…

items.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns after anti-corruption raids on his home
items.standfirst: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raid the home of a top aide to President Zelenskyy in connection with a major probe into an energy sector corruption scandal.
items.content: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raid the home of a top aide to President Zelenskyy in connection with a major probe into an energy sector corruption scandal.

items.title: Zelensky's top adviser resigns after Ukrainian anti-corruption raid on his home
items.standfirst: Andriy Yermak, 54, has been the Ukrainian president's chief of staff throughout Russia's full-scale war.
items.content: Andriy Yermak, 54, has been the Ukrainian president's chief of staff throughout Russia's full-scale war.

items.title: Zelenskyy’s top aide quits after anti-corruption searches of his home
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy chief of staff resigns after property raid by Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies – Europe live
items.standfirst: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...
items.content: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...

items.content: The loss of Volodymyr Zelenskyy's closest aide is a huge personal blow for the Ukrainian president, and could well weaken his authority.

items.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns as Ukraine corruption investigations widen
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide at heart of U.S. peace talks resigns after being implicated in corruption probe
items.standfirst: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war
items.content: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war

ai_summary: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his chief of staff.
The resignation follows anti-corruption agency searches of the aide's home.
The aide, Andriy Yermak, led peace talks with the United States.
Zelenskyy stated the resignation aimed to avoid speculation and rumors.
The departure occurred amid an ongoing corruption investigation in Ukraine.

The directive comes hours after President Trump said the US will pause migration from "third-world countries"

items.title: Trump says he plans to end immigration from "Third-World Countries"
items.standfirst: President Trump announced Thursday that he would "permanently pause" immigration from "Third-World Countries." The declaration comes as the Trump administration takes aim at U.S. immigration policies in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C. Weijia Jiang has the latest.

items.title: New video of ambush shooting of D.C. National Guard released
items.standfirst: New video has been released showing the gunman wielding a revolver in the ambush shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the suspected shooter's neighbor in Bellingham, Washington, told CBS News that federal officers raided the suspect's Bellingham apartment early Thursday morning. Nicole Sganga and Omar Villafranca have more on the attack and the suspect.

Nicole Sganga and Omar Villafranca have more on the attack and the suspect.

items.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises

items.title: Trump vows permanent pause on migration from 'third world countries' after D.C. shooting
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec
items.content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec

These actions followed the shooting of National Guard members in DC.

Police were directed to accompany National Guard members in DC.

ai_summary: Donald Trump announced plans to pardon former Honduran President Hernandez.
Hernandez was convicted of drug trafficking and weapons charges.
He is currently serving a 45-year prison sentence in the United States.
The pardon announcement came before Honduran presidential elections.
Trump stated Hernandez was treated unfairly, according to his sources.

The shooting occurred moments after the Palestinians appeared to surrender.
The incident is under review by the Israeli justice ministry.
An Israeli minister defended the killings, calling the victims terrorists.
The incident took place in the West Bank town of Jenin.

items.title: Death toll rises to 164 after floods and landslides on Indonesia’s Sumatra island
items.standfirst: The death toll from flash floods and landslides on Indonesia’s Sumatra island rose to 164 on Friday with 79 people missing, authorities said, as rescue workers found their efforts hampered by damaged bridges and roads and a lack of heavy equipment.

items.title: Airbus Warns A320 Fleet Needs Software Fix After Incident
items.standfirst: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.

The software issue could cause flight disruptions.
The recall follows an incident involving a JetBlue Airways airliner.

items.title: Jacob Zuma’s daughter resigns amid claims South Africans tricked to fight for Russia
items.standfirst: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla quits as MP after being accused of recruiting 17 men who are trapped in war-torn UkraineA daughter of the former South African president Jacob Zuma has resigned as an MP, after being accused of tricking 17 South African men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia to train as bodyguards for the Zumas’ uMkhonto weSizwe (MK) party.Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, 43, the most visible and active in politics of her siblings, volunteered to resign and step back from public roles while cooperating with a police investigation and working to bring the men home, the MK chair, Nkosinathi Nhleko, said at a press conference in Durban. Continue reading...
items.content: Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla quits as MP after being accused of recruiting 17 men who are trapped in war-torn UkraineA daughter of the former South African president Jacob Zuma has resigned as an MP, after being accused of tricking 17 South African men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia to train as bodyguards for the Zumas’ uMkhonto weSizwe (MK) party.Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla, 43, the most visible and active in politics of her siblings, volunteered to resign and step back from public roles while cooperating with a police investigation and working to bring the men home, the MK chair, Nkosinathi Nhleko, said at a press conference in Durban. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: New Democratic party victory is crushing defeat for Unity Labour, which has held power since 2001The New Democratic party (NDP) in the Caribbean country of St Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) is celebrating a historic landslide victory, taking 14 of 15 seats, according to preliminary results.The decisive vote was a crushing defeat for the Unity Labour party (ULP), which has been in power since 2001. ai_summary: The New Democratic Party won the election in Saint Vincent.
The NDP ousted Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves.
Gonsalves had been in office since 2001.
The NDP secured 14 of 15 seats in the election.
The victory was a crushing defeat for the Unity Labour party.
